knowledge_base.content: I am TK-Bot, a personal AI assistant for Tarun Karnati's portfolio. I provide fast, friendly, and accurate information about his skills, projects, and experience to recruiters and visitors. My knowledge comes directly from his professional data.

I represent Tarun in a professional yet conversational tone. I am approachable, confident, and insightful, just like Tarun when he talks about tech. I aim to make interactions smooth, engaging, and informative.
The best and most direct way to contact Tarun is by sending an email to tarunk1109@gmail.com.
You can connect with Tarun on LinkedIn at https://linkedin.com/in/tarun-karnati-84a95623b.
You can view Tarun's projects and code on his GitHub profile: https://github.com/Tarunk1109.
A downloadable PDF of Tarun's resume is available directly on his portfolio website. The link can be found on the main page.

Tarun is actively seeking full-time and co-op opportunities in Software Development. His goal is to contribute to innovative projects in full-stack development, AI systems, and cloud-based applications that solve real-world problems.

Tarun's long-term vision is to become a lead software engineer or solutions architect, where he can combine full-stack development, AI, and data-driven decision-making to build impactful technology products.
Tarun is fully eligible to work in Canada and open to both co-op and full-time positions.

Tarun Karnati is a Full-Stack Developer based in Toronto, Canada, known for building scalable applications with AI integrations. He specializes in Java, Spring Boot, and modern frontend technologies. His approach blends strong technical skills with creativity and real-world problem-solving.

Tarun is pursuing a Postgraduate Certificate in Information Technology Solutions at Humber College, Toronto (2025–2026). He earned a place on the Dean's Honour List for outstanding performance in Semester 1.
Tarun holds a Bachelor of Technology in Computer Science from SRK Institute of Technology, India (2020–2024), specializing in Data Science.
Tarun is proficient in Java, Python, JavaScript, C, HTML5, CSS3, SQL, and Bash.
He works with frameworks and databases like Spring Boot, Node.js, Express.js, MongoDB, and MySQL. He also uses Git, GitHub, and Docker for version control and deployment.
Tarun has hands-on experience with Generative AI, RAG pipelines, and fine-tuning LLMs using LangChain and OpenAI API. He has deployed full-stack apps using Docker, Netlify, and Heroku.
He’s passionate about Full-Stack Web Development, AI and Chatbots, Cloud DevOps (CI/CD), and creating intelligent automation systems.
Tarun is currently learning advanced AI development, system design, and cloud infrastructure using AWS and Azure. He also plans to explore microservices and Kubernetes soon.

Tarun is an excellent communicator and collaborator. He is known for being curious, adaptable, and detail-oriented, with a focus on writing clean, maintainable code. His problem-solving mindset helps him excel in team environments.
Tarun believes in continuous learning, teamwork, and integrity. He values efficiency, clear communication, and delivering real impact through technology.

Perkpal is a full-stack web application that provides personalized discounts and coupons for specific communities such as students and seniors. It demonstrates Tarun's ability to build a complete, scalable application with user categorization and secure authentication.

Perkpal uses Java and Spring Boot for the backend, MongoDB for the database, and HTML, CSS, and JavaScript for the frontend. Tarun designed the backend architecture and implemented data categorization logic.
The GitHub repository for Perkpal is available at https://github.com/Tarunk1109/PerkPal.

The IoT Women’s Safety Device is a real-time GPS-based tracking and emergency alert system designed to improve personal safety. The device demonstrates Tarun’s ability to merge software and hardware solutions.
Tarun led a four-member team, handling project architecture, Python programming for the microcontroller, and troubleshooting hardware integration issues.
His NLP project focused on sentiment analysis of product reviews using Python and machine learning models to extract insights. This project was published in the IJCRT journal.
You can view the NLP publication in IJCRT here: http://ijcrt.org/viewfull.php?&p_id=IJCRT2405210.
Tarun’s paper 'Fabric Defect Segmentation (DCNN)' was presented at the IPDIMS 2023 Conference and published by Springer.
Tarun has earned multiple certifications in software development, AI, and Docker that showcase his commitment to continuous learning.

He holds a 'Docker Foundations Professional' certificate from LinkedIn Learning: https://www.linkedin.com/learning/certificates/eb103cef361f6d528bfa297c6d730fb6579041cb4dc626e91377a9269aca1e39?u=2218586.

Tarun completed the 'Career Essentials in Software Development' certification by Microsoft and LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/learning/certificates/0a5fb95f1f2ab199e4ba32cbd91c56f8d8ba092a44026604ef8aa4b12d11a428?u=2218586.
He earned 'PCAP: Programming Essentials in Python' certification from Cisco Networking Academy.
Tarun also holds Coursera’s 'AI for Everyone' certification: https://www.coursera.org/account/accomplishments/verify/DHL7Z3VDD96C.
He gained practical exposure during a virtual AWS internship, where he learned about cloud architecture, data analytics, and AWS deployment.
Tarun has attended workshops on IoT System Design and Data Visualization with Tableau and Power BI to enhance his applied learning.
When asked about building a project from scratch, Tarun highlights Perkpal — where he handled database design, API development, and frontend integration for a live demo-ready product.
As project lead for the IoT Safety Device, Tarun demonstrated leadership and troubleshooting skills by resolving hardware-software conflicts and guiding the team to completion.
Tarun’s strengths include logical problem-solving, adaptability, and deep technical curiosity. He’s quick to learn new tools and loves applying AI to real-world solutions.
Tarun’s portfolio includes light/dark mode, smooth UI, and an interactive AI chatbot — TK-Bot — built to help visitors and recruiters learn about him easily.
Outside of coding, Tarun enjoys gym workouts, playing outdoor sports, exploring new technologies, and watching motivational or tech content.
Tarun is friendly, professional, and direct in communication. He believes in simplicity and clarity — both in code and conversations.
He believes in 'build, learn, improve' — focusing on constant progress, learning from feedback, and staying humble yet ambitious.
Tarun aims to create tech that improves everyday life — combining full-stack systems with AI-driven personalization and automation.
